results.firPara: Sam Allardyce is poised to formalise his return to football at Crystal Palace over the next 24 hours after his ill-fated 67-day stint as England manager, as the struggling Premier League club seek to make a swift appointment following the sacking of Alan Pardew.
results.secPara: Palace dismissed Pardew on Thursday after almost two years in charge with the team having lost eight of their past 10 league games, and 22 over the calendar year, to slump to within a point of the relegation zone. Allardyce departed his position with the Football Association in September after one match having been filmed discussing FA rules on third-party ownership by undercover reporters. The 62-year-olds representative was holding talks with Palaces chairman, Steve Parish, on Thursday evening.
results.webTitle: Sam Allardyce set to take Crystal Palace job after Alan Pardew’s sacking

results.firPara: Crystal Palace could turn their attention to the Levante striker Roger Martí if Newcastle United are unwilling to part company with Aleksandar Mitrovic in the January transfer window.
results.secPara: Palace have indicated that they would be willing to pay £15m to secure Mitrovic, who has started just four games for Newcastle in the Championship so far this season, with Swansea City also interested in the Serbia international.
results.webTitle: Crystal Palace target Levante’s Roger Martí as Newcastle stand firm over Mitrovic

results.firPara: Antonio Conte has expressed regret that Steve Holland is to leave his coaching staff at Chelsea at the end of the season to take up a permanent position with Gareth Southgates England setup but has admitted his assistant could not turn down a rare opportunity to work with the national team.
results.secPara: Holland, who has been combining his role as first-team assistant manager at Chelsea with life as No2 to Southgate, initially with the England Under-21s, since 2013, will depart Stamford Bridge after eight years on the staff next summer. The 46-year-old was originally appointed Chelseas reserve-team manager in August 2009 and was promoted to the senior setup as assistant first-team coach by André Villas-Boas two years later.
results.webTitle: Chelsea’s Antonio Conte disappointed to lose Steve Holland to England

results.firPara: A star of the 1920s amateur era in France, Mony was widely respected until the May night in Boulogne when he gunned down his best friend who he thought was having an affair with his wife
results.secPara: The following is an extract from issue 23 of the Blizzard, which is on sale in December. The Blizzard is a quarterly football journal available from www.theblizzard.co.uk on a pay-what-you-like basis in print and digital formats.
results.webTitle: Pierre Mony: the footballer so popular he got away with murder

results.firPara: Slaven Bilic has said West Ham will do all they can to keep their top player Dimitri Payet during the January transfer window.
results.secPara: Payet has again been the subject of interest from other clubs as the window approaches, with Arsenal and Manchester United linked with the France international. But Bilic says the attention is expected and could motivate the player to perform better for his current employers.
results.webTitle: West Ham do not want to sell team’s ‘top player’ Dimitri Payet, says Slaven Bilic

results.firPara: Joe Sumner, a Newcastle fan, and Evertonian PJ Harrison are aiming to make American soccer more blue collar with their new club in California
results.secPara: It went largely unnoticed but something unusual occurred this week two Englishmen became owners of a foreign football club. It is their creation too. The licence has been granted, a long-term business plan and proof of funding vetted and now City of Angels FC – the latest addition to the growing football scene in Los Angeles – has until the start of the National Premier Soccer League season in March to finalise terms on a stadium, appoint a director of football and construct its first team. No one ever said it was going to be easy.
results.webTitle: Why Sting’s son has gone in search of the new Messi to launch City of Angels FC

results.firPara: Not only has Zlatan Ibrahimovic been flying the flag for combustible iconoclasts since his arrival in the Premier League, he has also been doing it for the oldies. At 35 the Swede is cocking a snook at the idea football is a young mans game. He has scored 10 goals in his past nine games for Manchester United and generally been at the heart of their upturn in form. But the Premier League has a history of superannuated heroes. Here are 10 other memorable players who made their Premier League debuts in their fourth decade. The order is definitive.
results.secPara: Debut 16 November 1996. Age 30 years, 4 months, 11 days
results.webTitle: Golden oldies: Premier League’s best over-30s before Zlatan Ibrahimovic

results.firPara: Todays fluff is deep and crisp and even
results.secPara: Todays fluff is deep and crisp and even
results.webTitle: Football transfer rumours: Virgil van Dijk to Manchester City for £50m?

results.firPara: • Manchester United manager I want to stay in most difficult place to win
results.secPara: • Manchester United manager I want to stay in most difficult place to win
results.webTitle: José Mourinho: I’m too young to consider managing in China

results.firPara: Chelsea hope to use the money raised by Oscars £60m departure for Shanghai SIPG to reinforce in midfield and defence next month, with discussions also planned with Diego Costas representatives aimed at securing the striker to a new deal.
results.secPara: Oscars club-record sale to the Chinese Super League side should be confirmed before the transfer window opens and, while Chelsea always anticipated being active in the market, the money will be ploughed back into the side. Antonio Conte has seen his team move six points clear at the top of the Premier League but will hope to add at least two players to bolster his options and maintain momentum.
results.webTitle: Chelsea target Tiemoué Bakayoko and Djibril Sidibé after £60m Oscar windfall
